intro: Richea victoriana, commonly known as the Victoriana richea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are leathery and arranged in a spiral pattern, while the flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Richea victoriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and well-drained soils.
